knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.discove: Ancient temples containing Collector Crystals are normally located in very cold, very hot, or very mountainous areas, but only if enough level ground exists to build a temple upon. The crystals will always be attuned to one of the five Bright constellations.

While indicator plumes are only visible above ground, Rock Crystal Ore spawns at the lowest depths: at bedrock. While occassional groupings may be within several steps of each other, it is rare and often will have tens or hundreds of meters between rock crystal ores. If holding a Resonating Wand in either hand, sparkles will show through the stone surrounding the ore when within a few strides to aid in locating it.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.misc.al: All altars have the ability to craft multiple copies of the same item, as long as all the ingredients are stacked up in the table at once, and it has sufficient starlight and time to complete the crafting operation. This is more valuable with higher tier altars, due to increased crafting speed and starlight reservoir size.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.discove: While only crystals generated with the world will automatically link to crafting tables placed near them, any collector crystal can be linked to a table using a Linking Tool to achieve the same effect. Collectors (or lenses carrying collector starlight) can also be linked into a network to provide starlight to any consumer of starlight, no matter if table, altar, or device.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.explora: While catalyst duration is subject to the whims of the world, the distillation rate of Liquid Starlight can be vastly increased within that time. Placing a Lightwell in areas of high starlight concentration will increase efficiency, as will linking one to a starlight network.<NL>Durability of catalyst lifespan increases as follows: Aquamarine, Resonating Aquamarine, Rock Crystal, Celestial Crystal, Attuned Rock Crystal, Attuned Celestial Crystal.

Lightwells are not limited in creating only Liquid Starlight. By using snow or ice blocks, a Lightwell can distill water. Distillation of lava can also be achieved by using netherrack or magma blocks, as well. The same principles apply for production efficiency as for Liquid Starlight.

If a crystal with maximum size is continuously placed into Liquid Starlight, there is a 25%% chance that the crystal will destabilize from the starlight exposure, undergoing spontaneous division and "birthing" an additional crystal. While both crystals will see an impact to their size and facet cuts during this division, the emerging "child" crystal will often see fewer impurities over its parent, by an almost 10%% purity increase in some cases. This process can be continued with each new generation of crystal until no impurities remain.

Crystal tools operate differently than most normal tools due to their construction, with three stats governing their performance.<NL>Purity - Higher purity tools lose less size when grinding.<NL>Size - Durability of the tool. Lost when sharpened, and recovered by soaking in Liquid Starlight. When the size of a tool is 0, the tool is destroyed.<NL>Cutting - Determines a tool's efficiency, and can be recovered via sharpening. Much like a knife, the tool will dull more quickly when very sharp than when already somewhat dulled. The "Unbreaking" enchantment slows cutting losses.

In addition to shaping crystals, a Grindstone used to grind up an ore may sometimes generate more dust than is needed for a single ingot smelting.<NL>Swords can also be sharpened on a Grindstone, increasing the damage. The increase is higher for swords that are naturally more damaging, though some worlds may see the degree of improvement to be higher than others.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.misc.ca: Any device that collects starlight gathers it from within 8 blocks radius of the device itself. Much like rain-collecting barrels overlapping each other, devices sharing circular gathering areas will see diminished returns as each can only gather the same starlight once. Spreading out any devices that collect starlight, regardless of device type, so they are 16 paces apart will prevent them from cannibalising the starlight gathered from each other.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.explora: When active, a Cave Illuminator attempts to fill in dark areas, placing lights in a spiralling pattern from a center marked by the Illuminator itself, out to its maximum range. It maintains a vertical distance approximately 8 meters apart for light "layers" when performing these placements.

When without sky access, or if it is not nighttime, a Cave Illuminator can be powered by an Illumination Wand for 10 seconds at a time when right-clicked.<NL>Additionally, the color of a Cave Illuminator's spawned lights will change to match the color the Illumination Wand has been dyed.
The powder draws from the monsters that innately spawn where it is located. Natural rarity of the monsters in that is ignored, so all possibilities have an equal spawning chance.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.attunem: The issue with all things, is that when not being watched, the world seems to stand still for them. Lenses, and other Starlight Network transmission pieces, are kept active by the starlight itself, and so do not stop working when not observed, no matter how far away the nearest person is. The same cannot be said for the blocks they are acting upon.
The absorbed energy used by various focusing tools will recover slowly when left on its own. When under the open sky, or during the night, it will recover much more quickly.
While many objects can be attuned to Bright or Dim constellations, people can only be attuned to Brights.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.perk_ge: The time of day the cluster is harvested impacts the power of the resulting Gem, whether during the Day, at Night, or during Dusk and Dawn.<NL>The less sunlight in the sky when harvested, the more powerful the enhancements, though fewer. More sunlight during harvest results in weaker, but more numerous, enhancements. Gem enhancements vary from 2 to 4 in number.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.attunem: Extensive testing has shown there is no limit to the amount of starlight that may be channeled into a ritual, which means there is no limit to how frequently a ritual will function. However, the faster a ritual is forced to operate, the more likely that stresses on the crystal in the ritual pedestal will begin to fracture apart, eventually leading to its destruction if not allowed to repair in liquid starlight.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.constel: Ignition: Sets things on fire, and can smelt items dropped into its beam or blocks placed in the beam like a furnace.<NL>Growth: Functions like bonemeal, unless the plant doesn't like bonemeal, in which case it just makes it grow quickly.<NL>Break: Has no harvest level, unlike a pick, it just breaks things that are breakable.<NL>Damage: Deals a set amount of damage, with frequency based on amount of starlight being channeled.

While up to three constellations can be placed at a time, duplicates provide no bonus. Perfect placement involves minimizing overlap of the constellations drawn.<NL>Using this table as close to midnight as possible will minimize the risk of fire, and directly enchanting objects while using it can result in enchanted items with combinations conventional enchanting cannot match.

Placing a sapling within reach and causing it to grow will generate the ghostly starlight version of the tree. Resonant echoes of this ghost will be used by the Beacon to fabricate far more items than harvesting the tree would normally provide on its own. It also has the benefit of performing this on multiple trees with reach, without the hassle of waiting for constant growth of more saplings, or diminished tool durability.

While a Tree Beacon operates much more effectively during the night, it is possible to accelerate it to mind-boggling rates using channeled starlight, much like a ritual. Linking starlight to a Tree Beacon will increase the rate at which it fabricates tree parts, with the light of Aevitas providing the biggest increase.<NL>A Tree Beacon is less likely to fabricate foliage than logs.

Axe: Harvests the entire tree at once when used on a log.<NL>Sword: Deals a magical burst of damage around the target.<NL>Pickaxe: Indicates what ores are nearby, and their direction, when right-clicked.<NL>Shovel: Digs a large hole in a horizontal orientation.
Blocks converted to their Illuminated state are unbreakable.

Each Resplendent Prism has three modifiers for changing enchantments, with each modifier providing up to a +3 bonus to one or more enchantments. Any combination of boosting existing enchantments or adding new enchantments is possible. However, any modifier that increases all existing enchantments will occupy two of these modifier slots.<NL>The color of the Prism is random, with white being far more rare than all the others.

Testing has confirmed that clusters not only grow more quickly, but have a chance to provide more than one usable crystal if grown and harvested while on top of starmetal ore. Preliminary testing has also shown that the crystals harvested tend to be of higher purity.
If provided with starlight from a Starlight Network, or simply access to the night sky, crystal clusters will grow more quickly.
In addition to preventing starlight losses due to daytime, or the constellation not being in the sky, the structure aids in gathering efficiency, with 10%% gains.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.radianc: As the internal reservoir of an Evershifting Fountain is finite, the increased rate of Liquid Starlight consumption caused by more mythical creatures can result in early release. Endermen don't often trigger this unless left trapped for a bit, but something like a Wither or Ender Dragon can leave a much more short window wherein they are held trapped. Beings beyond even their power should be expected to be held for even less time, should they exist.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.misc.pe: There are three magnitudes of bonuses provided by internal starlight.<NL>Added/Subtracted - Adds a flat value to the base amount.<NL>Increased/Decreased - All of thse are added together, then applied as a percentage change after all Added/Subtracted values are applied.<NL>More/Less - Applied individually as a percentage change following Increase/Decrease changes, not summed and then applied.
knowledge.astralsorcery.fragment.constel: Grants increased Strength, potentially double that of conventional potions.
Grants increased Power and Sharpness to weapons. The strength will never be as weak as low-level conventional enchantments, and could potentially be stronger.
All mobs within the area of this field suffer regularly occurring damage, with the intensity of that damage increasing as more starlight is channeled into the ritual.

Corruption of the light turns it from an offensive weapon, into an empowerment of foes. Mobs find themselves rapidly healed of damage and highly resistance to additional damage, while those previously protected by the constellation find themselves under attack.
Roughly 1/3 of the power of the last blow dealt against the wearer is channeled back into enemies by the wearer's attacks.
Grants increased Protection to armor. The strength will never be as weak as low-level conventional enchantments, and could potentially be stronger.
Rapid and constant application of force drives mobs and projectiles directly away from the ritual pedestal or anchor.
Protection turns into assault, with previously repelled creatures instead greatly empowered by the ritual effect.
The mantle can store up to 3 charges, each charge will completely negate one damaging attack against the wearer. A mantle can be fully charged from empty in under 1 minute.
Grants increased Speed, ranging from the strongest conventional potions of swiftness to double their strength.
Reduces the damage received from Falling. The strength will never be as weak as low-level conventional enchantments, and could potentially be stronger.

The amount of starlight received by this ritual has two effects, frequency of application of flight and total radius of the ritual. As radius is controlled by the maximum number of lenses providing starlight feedback on the ritual altar, that means that one effect of this ritual does, indeed, have a maximum cap at 5 lenses.
The air turns against those within the ritual, disabling flight abilities and greatly slowing those sensitive to starlight.
Unlike a normal elytra, this mantle does not decay from usage of the flight abilities, and it is faster.
Grants accelerate life Regeneration, up to potentially double that of conventional potions.

Provides for Mending of items. While the strength of the effect can exceed conventional enchantments, it does not appear anyone has yet discovered a method to improve the power of the mending effect to take advantage of this.

Increasing the starlight fed to this ritual doesn't increase power of its effects, only how often it applies them. This makes boosting the ritual less important for the regeneration effect, and far more important for large fields of plants.
The light of creation turns to decay, with nearby plants succumbing to the draining effects, and creatures find themselves sapped of both energy and life.
There is no way to determine what a plant will change to when effected by the power of this mantle. Be wary of trees in enclosed spaces.
Mining and Attack speed is increased by these potions. Attack speed could potentially be increased by nearly half, and mining speed by more than three-quarters.
Increases the Efficiency of enchanted items. While the strength of this enchantment will not exceed conventional enchantment strength, it will never be as weak as low level conventional enchantments.
This will not destroy unbreakable blocks, lava, or water.
Destruction turns to creation, as nearby stone and dirt become random valuable ores.
Breaking blocks effects others within the same "plane", and applies 50%% of the life of a creature killed by the wearer as damage to other nearby mobs.
Mining and Attack speed is increased by these potions. Attack speed could potentially be increased by nearly half, and mining speed by more than three-quarters.
Increases the wielder's good Fortune when harvesting blocks.
Feeding additional starlight into this ritual affects how often it converts stone, the maximum reach stays the same.
Instead of converting stone to ores of value, the ritual now creates chunks of stone where there is none, but only beneath those within reach.
The held block will be displayed if within roughly 20 paces, and even works if in the off-hand.
Grants the ability to see in the dark.
Provides for the ability to see in the dark.

Unlike most other rituals, there is a cap to the effectiveness of this ritual based on total lenses reflecting light back to the pedestal. Additional starlight beyond what is needed to fuel five lenses has no impact, as the ritual range will not increase beyond that point.
While the sun is down, starlight reigns while the rest of the world seems to slow.
The visibility range for mobs and spawners illuminated by this mantle is roughly three dozen paces.
While the initial appearance of this constellation could be anytime between the third and fifth weeks of any given world, subsequent appearances will always be 36 days apart.
The power of this constellation grants not only increased Speed, but faster movements by more than twice.

Good Fortune and Luck overflow for the wielder of these enchantments, with even the weakest versions being as strong or stronger than conventional enchanting, and the strongest being twice that of a conventional enchantment.

While there is no maximum to the rate of acceleration of affected blocks, world instability could increase the faster this accelerates. Boosting this ritual should be done with care in highly populated worlds.
Creatures are removed from the flow of time in the localized area.
Affects all mobs within 20 paces for roughly 9 seconds when triggered. Can be triggered roughly once per minute, though it is not guaranteed for any given hit against the wearer.
Mild improvement to visibility underwater, and water breathing.
Extends the length of time breath can be held while underwater, and lengthens the amount of time needed to drown once out of breath.
Any fishable item could be retrieved by this ritual into the nearby waters.
The oceans and the land invert, with water replacing air, fish spawning from nothing, and some liquids drying to sand.
The normal penalties for moving and attempting to use tools underwater are negated, and other methods of underwater breathing aren't required.
These potions replenish hunger and saturation both.
Delicate items can be picked up without breaking, as though touched by silk.
Increasing starlight provided to this ritual will not increase the number of resources per animal, but it will increase how often these resources may be shed.
Damaged creatures of the field are slaughtered, though with an overabundance of resources from their corpses.
Flares will only attack those who have hit the player, and will attack the most recent attacker.
Enchantments deal fire damage, set enemies on fire, and automatically smelt harvested blocks.
Due to the nature of the ritual, blocks with exceptionally high melting points such as ores will not be melted, only those that melt into lava or water.
Liquids are chilled, fires drained of heat, and the very moisture in the air turned to ice.
While the default healing won't result in a net gain of health, effects that boost the healing will result in a net gain.
This constellation only appears when the moon is in the Full or New phases.
These potions provide superior health recovery, potentially higher than conventional potions. They also can provide magical damage Absorption.
Superior fishing rods and bows that never run out of ammunition can be enchantable.
This ritual will continue to summon creatures irrelevant of presence of a Lucerna ritual.
The darkness inside creatures is called forth, irrevocably twisting them into a darker form. Creatures so changed are filled with valuable items that burst forth when they are slain.
Spectral tools or weapons will only spawn if the proper tool is held in the main hand.
The chill of these brewed potions extends fire resistance, resistance to damage, and causes slowness of speed.
Converting water that is walked on into a solid surface of ice, reducing damage from speedy falls, and solidifying tools and armor to reduce breakage are all within the realm of these enchants.
While expanding the reach of the ritual nearly 4 times over, it also decreases the power of the ritual to nearly 1/6th of the previous strength.
While increasing natural health regeneration and instantly healing some damage as it is taken, these brewed potions also reduce the damage that can be dealt in return.
Normal protective enchantments conflict with each other, preventing armor from channeling the energies of more than one. Enchantments from the light of this constellation have no such restriction.
Ritual power is increased to four times normal, but the area of the ritual is reduced to 1/5th normal.
Both harmonious and destructive resonance stem from the distillations of this constellation, increasing a drinker's Luck and removing them from view, while also increasing their hunger.

Fishing rods send out subtle vibrations, greatly increasing fishing yields, while those same vibrations improve harvesting delicate blocks. Swords enchanted have a destructive resonance, spreading their cuts to other nearby enemies.
Rituals are corrupted, and the strain of that causes the ritual crystal to fracture like a house of cards in a strong breeze when any starlight is received by the crystal.
In exchange for instilling lethargy with tools this brew helps fight through lesser injuries and greatly increases damage from weapon swings.
All foes will find themselves at the mercy of your weapons, which will strike far harder than normal.
This constellation doubles ritual power and increases the reach of a ritual by three-quarters, but at the cost of increased fracturation of the ritual crystal.
